tit.cmt: 「王政復古」と「王制復古」の使い分けをしました。前者を"Restoration of Royal (Imperial) Rule"とし、後者を"Restoration of Monarchy"としました。

sen.j: 王政復古（おうせいふっこ, restoration）は、かつて君主によって統治されていた国家において、一度はクーデターや内戦などによって廃止された君主制が、何等かの理由によって復活することである。
sen.e: "Oseifukko" means for a country that had once been ruled by a monarch before its monarchy was abolished by coups or civil wars, to restore its old monarchy by some reason.
"Oseifukko" refers to a country once ruled by a monarch before the monarchy was abolished by coups or civil wars, but then restored its monarchy for some reason.
"Oseifukko" refers to a country once ruled by a monarch before the monarchy was abolished by coups or civil wars, but then restored its monarchy for some reason.

sen.j: 政体が帝国の場合は帝政復古とも言う。
sen.e: If the constitution of the country had been an empire, its restoration may be called "Teiseifukko" (Restoration of Imperial Rule).
If the constitution of the country was that of an empire, its restoration can be called "Teiseifukko" (Restoration of Imperial Rule).
If the constitution of the country was that of an empire, its restoration can be called "Teiseifukko" (Restoration of Imperial Rule).

sen.j: 王政復古は2類型に分類できる。
sen.e: Oseifukko (Restoration of Royal Rule) may be classified into two types.
Oseifukko (Restoration of Royal Rule) may be classified into two types.
Oseifukko (Restoration of Royal Rule) may be classified into two types.

sen.j: 1つ目は、王家は制度上存在するものの立憲君主制や豪族支配等により君権が抑圧された状態から、君主親政が復活するケースである。
sen.e: The first case is a restoration of direct administration by a royal family from such conditions as their ruling power was limited by repression from constitutional monarchy system or by some powerful clans.
The first case is a restoration of direct administration by a royal family from such conditions whereby the ruling power was repressed due to a constitutional monarchy system or by powerful clans.
The first case is a restoration of direct administration by a royal family from such conditions whereby the ruling power was repressed due to a constitutional monarchy system or by powerful clans.

sen.j: 例として、日本の明治維新（1868年の徳川家の支配からの王政復古）、ネパール（1951年ラナ家の支配からの王政復古、2005年の立憲君主制からの王政復古）がある。
sen.e: Some examples are Japan's Meiji Restoration in 1868 where Imperial power was restored from the control of Tokugawa family, as well as Nepal's cases one of which was the restoration of King's reign from the contol of Rana family in 1951, and another one of which was the shifting of its political system from the constitutional monarchy to the King's direct administration in 2005.

Some examples include Japan's Meiji Restoration in 1868 where Imperial power was restored from the control of the Tokugawa family, as well as Nepal's cases, one of which was the restoration of the King's reign from the contol of the Rana family in 1951, and another one where the political system shifted from the constitutional monarchy to the King's direct administration in 2005.

Some examples include Japan's Meiji Restoration in 1868 where Imperial power was restored from the control of the Tokugawa family, as well as Nepal's cases, one of which was the restoration of the King's reign from the control of the Rana family in 1951, and another one where the political system shifted from the constitutional monarchy to the King's direct administration in 2005.

sen.j: 2つ目は、共和制の状態から君主制が復活するケースである。
sen.e: The second case of Oseifukko (Restoration of Royal Rule) is a revival of monarchy from republican institutions.
The second case of Oseifukko (Restoration of Royal Rule) involves a revival of a monarchy from republican institutions.
The second case of Oseifukko (Restoration of Royal Rule) involves a revival of a monarchy from republican institutions.

sen.j: イギリス（1660年）、スペイン（1975年フランシスコ・フランコ独裁からの王制復古）、カンボジア（1993年内戦の収拾と民主化による王制復古）等がある。
sen.e: Some of its examples are restorations of monarchy in England in 1660, and in Spain in 1975 where monarchy was restored from the dictatorship of Francisco FRANCO, as well as in Cambodia in 1993 where monarchy was reestablished by cease of civil wars and start of democratization.

Some of examples are the restored monarchies of England in 1660, and Spain in 1975 where the monarchy was restored from the dictatorship of Francisco FRANCO, as well as in Cambodia in 1993 when the monarchy was reestablished after civil warfare ceased and democratization gained a foothold.

Some of examples are the restored monarchies of England in 1660, and Spain in 1975 where the monarchy was restored from the dictatorship of Francisco FRANCO, as well as in Cambodia in 1993 when the monarchy was reestablished after civil warfare ceased and democratization gained a foothold.

sen.j: 君主制が復活しても、憲法を制定するなど立憲君主制、民主政を採用した場合は「王制復古」と呼ばれる場合がある。
sen.e: Oseifukko, or restoration of monarchy, may sometimes be referred to the countries which established constitutional monarchy or democracy under monarchy.
Oseifukko, or restoration of monarchy, may sometimes refer to the countries which establish a constitutional monarchy or a democracy under monarchy.
Oseifukko', or restoration of monarchy, may sometimes refer to the countries which establish a constitutional monarchy or a democracy under monarchy.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分に' 'を付加しました。

sen.j: 詳細は建武の新政を参照
sen.e: For details, please refer to Kenmu no Shinsei (Kenmu Restoration).
For details, please refer to Kenmu no Shinsei (Kenmu Restoration).
For details, please refer to Kenmu no Shinsei (Kenmu Restoration).

sen.j: 1333年（元弘3年/正慶2年）、後醍醐天皇は鎌倉幕府の倒幕を成し遂げ、建武の新政を開始した。
sen.e: In 1333, Emperor Godaigo overthrew the Shogunate and started Kenmu no Shinsei (Kenmu restoration).
In 1333, Emperor Godaigo overthrew the Shogunate and started Kenmu no Shinsei (Kenmu restoration).
In 1333, the Emperor Godaigo overthrew the Shogunate and started Kenmu no Shinsei (Kenmu restoration).
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 建武の新政は天皇親政の復活である。
sen.e: "Kenmu no Shinsei" means a restoration of Emperor's direct administration, which restoration was more genuine than Meiji Restoration in the sense of the word "Oseifukko" (restoration of imperial rule).

"Kenmu no Shinsei" means a restoration of the Emperor's direct administration. This restoration was more genuine than the Meiji Restoration in the sense of the word "Oseifukko" (restoration of imperial rule).
"Kenmu no Shinsei" means a restoration of the Emperor's direct administration.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: この点では明治維新のときの王政復古 (日本)よりもより純粋な意味での王政復古であるといえる。
sen.e: This restoration was more genuine than the Meiji Restoration in the sense of the word "Oseifukko" (restoration of imperial rule).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 建武の新政は英語では Kemmu Restoration と訳されている。
sen.e: "Kenmu no Shinsei" is translated as Kenmu Restoration in English.
"Kenmu no Shinsei" is translated as Kenmu Restoration in English.
"Kenmu no Shinsei" is translated as Kenmu Restoration in English.

tit.j: 王政復古の大号令・明治維新
tit.e: Declaration of Imperial Rule, Meiji Restoration
Declaration of Imperial Rule, Meiji Restoration
Declaration of Imperial Rule, Meiji Restoration

sen.j: 詳細は王政復古 (日本) を参照
sen.e: For details, please refer to Oseifukko (Japan) (Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan).
For details, please refer to Oseifukko (Japan) (Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan).
For details, please refer to Oseifukko (Japan) (Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan).

sen.j: 慶応3年12月9日（グレゴリオ暦1868年1月3日）、明治天皇の名により天皇親政を宣言した。
sen.e: On January 3, 1868, the declaration of emperor's direct administration over Japan was made under the name of Emperor Meiji.
On January 3, 1868, the declaration of the emperor's direct administration over Japan was made under the name of Emperor Meiji.
On January 3, 1868, the declaration of the emperor's direct administration over Japan was made under the name of the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 王政復古の大号令とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: This is also called the Declaration of Imperial Rule.
This is also called the Declaration of Imperial Rule.
This is also called the Declaration of Imperial Rule.

sen.j: 内容は(1)摂関制度（摂政・関白）の廃止(2)（慶喜の）将軍職辞職を勅許(3)江戸幕府の廃止(4)（新たに）総裁、議定、参与の三職をおくというもので、江戸幕府の廃絶と、天皇による新政府の成立を宣言するものであった。
sen.e: It was a declaration to abolish the Edo Shogunate and to establish a new Imperial government; more specifically, (1) abolishment of sekkan-seido (a system of regents and advisors), (2) imperial consent to Yoshinobu's resignation of Shogunate, (3) abolishment of the Edo Shogunate, and (4) appointment to the posts of new three offices, namely sosai (president), gijo (official post) and sanyo (councilor).

It was a declaration to abolish the Edo Shogunate and to establish a new Imperial government; more specifically, (1) abolishment of sekkan-seido (a system of regents and advisors), (2) imperial consent to Yoshinobu's resignation of Shogunate, (3) abolishment of the Edo Shogunate, and (4) appointment to the posts of three new offices, namely sosai (president), gijo (official post) and sanyo (councilor).

It was a declaration to abolish the Edo Shogunate and to establish a new Imperial government; more specifically, (1) abolishment of sekkan-seido (a system of regents and advisors), (2) imperial consent to Yoshinobu's resignation of Shogunate, (3) abolishment of the Edo Shogunate, and (4) appointment to the posts of three new offices, namely sosai (president), gijo (official post) and sanyo (councilor).

sen.j: 明治天皇は満15歳と若く、政治の実権は岩倉具視ら一部の公家と薩摩藩・長州藩が掌握していたが、形式上は天皇親政を宣言するものであった。
sen.e: Because Emperor Meiji was then only fifteen years old, the political initiative was taken by some court nobles including Tomomi IWAKURA and some retainers of Satsuma and Choshu domains, but, nevertheless, emperor's direct administration was formally declared.

Because Emperor Meiji was then only fifteen years old, some court nobles including Tomomi IWAKURA and some retainers of Satsuma and Choshu domains took the political initiative, but, nevertheless, emperor's direct administration was formally declared.
sen.cmt: "took the political initiative" this doesn’t make sense
sen.e: Because the Emperor Meiji was then only fifteen years old, some court nobles including Tomomi IWAKURA and some retainers of Satsuma and Choshu domains took the political initiative, but, nevertheless, emperor's direct administration was formally declared.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 王政復古の大号令は、慶応3年10月14日 (旧暦)に征夷大将軍徳川慶喜が政権を返上（大政奉還）し討幕の大義名分が失われたため、討幕派であった岩倉具視や大久保利通らが、討幕の大義名分を得るために決行したクーデターであった。
sen.e: The Declaration of Imperial Rule was a kind of coups staged by anti-shogunate movement of Tomomi IWAKURA, Toshimichi OKUBO and others in order to justify their movement against Tokugawa shogunate when they had lost their official rationale to defeat shogunate through Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA's voluntary Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) on November 9, 1867.
sen.cmt: 慶応3年10月14日は西暦1867年11月9日です。
sen.e: The Declaration of Imperial Rule was a kind of coups staged by the anti-shogunate movement of Tomomi IWAKURA, Toshimichi OKUBO and others in order to justify their movement against the Tokugawa shogunate after they lost their official rationale to defeat the shogunate through Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA's voluntary Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) on November 9, 1867.

The Declaration of Imperial Rule was a kind of coups staged by the anti-shogunate movement of Tomomi IWAKURA, Toshimichi OKUBO and others in order to justify their movement against the Tokugawa shogunate after they lost their official rationale to defeat the shogunate through Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA's voluntary Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) on November 9, 1867.

sen.j: その後討幕は成就し、明治維新（英語では Meiji Restoration）が実現した。
sen.e: Afterward, the movement to defeat shogunate was eventually accomplished, and Meiji Restoration was realized.
Afterward, the movement to defeat the shogunate was eventually accomplished, and the Meiji Restoration was realized.
Afterward, the movement to defeat the shogunate was eventually accomplished, and the Meiji Restoration was realized.

sen.j: 1642年に清教徒革命が起こった。
sen.e: In 1642, the Puritan Revolution broke out.
In 1642, the Puritan Revolution broke out.
In 1642, the Puritan Revolution broke out.

sen.j: 革命の指導者オリバー・クロムウェルは1649年にチャールズ1世 (イングランド王)を処刑し、王政が廃止された。
sen.e: In 1649, Oliver Cromwell, the leader of the revolution, executed Charles I (then King of England) and abolished monarchy.
In 1649, Oliver Cromwell, the leader of the revolution, executed Charles I (then King of England) and abolished the monarchy.
In 1649, Oliver Cromwell, the leader of the revolution, executed Charles I (then King of England) and abolished the monarchy.

sen.j: 議会派はクロムウェルを護国卿に任命したが、その死後に護国卿を継承した子のリチャード・クロムウェルには政治力が無く、自ら辞任を申し出た。
sen.e: Parliamentarians appointed their leader Cromwell as the Lord Protector of the Commonwealth, but, after his death, his child Richard Cromwell who succeeded the post of Lord Protector had little political clout and offered his voluntary resignation from the post.

Parliamentarians appointed their leader Cromwell as the Lord Protector of the Commonwealth, but, after his death, his child Richard Cromwell who succeeded the post of Lord Protector had little political clout and offered his voluntary resignation from the post.

Parliamentarians appointed their leader Cromwell as the Lord Protector of the Commonwealth, but, after his death, his child Richard Cromwell who succeeded the post of Lord Protector had little political clout and offered his voluntary resignation from the post.

sen.j: また、国民全体が清教徒のよく言えば純粋、悪く言えば独善的な行動に嫌気がさしていた。
sen.e: Also, then entire nation of England felt tired of puritans' innocence in a good sense but self-righteous activities in a bad sense.
This made the nation of England grow tired of the puritans' innocence in a good sense but self-righteous activities in a bad sense.
This made the nation of England grow tired of the puritans' innocence in a good sense but self-righteous activities in a bad sense.

sen.j: そのため、議会はチャールズ1世の子チャールズ2世 (イングランド王)に王権を返還し、1660年にステュアート朝が復活した。
sen.e: Consequently, the parliament decided to reassign the sovereignty of England to Charles II (King of England) who was a child of Charles I, and restarted the Stuart Dynasty in 1660.
Consequently, the parliament decided to reassign the sovereignty of England to Charles II (King of England) who was a child of Charles I, and restarted the Stuart Dynasty in 1660.
Consequently, the parliament decided to reassign the sovereignty of England to Charles II (King of England) who was a child of Charles I, and restarted the Stuart Dynasty in 1660.

sen.j: 詳細はフランス復古王政を参照
sen.e: For details, pleaser refer to French Restauration.
For details, pleaser refer to French Restauration.
For details, please refer to French Restauration.

sen.j: 1792年8月10日、フランス革命政府は国王ルイ16世 (フランス王)を逮捕し王権を停止。
sen.e: On August 10, 1792, the French Revolution Government arrested their King Louis XVI (King of France) and suspended his sovereignty.
On August 10, 1792, the French Revolution Government arrested their King Louis XVI (King of France) and suspended his sovereignty.
On August 10, 1792, the French Revolution Government arrested their King Louis XVI (King of France) and suspended his sovereignty.

sen.j: 翌1793年に国民公会がルイ16世の処刑を議決しギロチン送りとした。
sen.e: In the following year, the National Convention decided to execute King Louis XVI by guillotine.
In the following year, the National Convention decided to execute King Louis XVI by guillotine.
In the following year, the National Convention decided to execute King Louis XVI by guillotine.

sen.j: 以降フランスはフランス第一共和政へ、さらにフランス第一帝政へと移行した。
sen.e: Since then, France moved into the First Republican France and furthermore into the First Imperial France.
Since then, France transitioned to the First Republican France and furthermore into the First Imperial France.
Since then, France transitioned to the First Republican France and furthermore into the First Imperial France.

sen.j: 1814年、ナポレオン戦争に敗れた皇帝ナポレオン・ボナパルトが退位し、ルイ16世の弟ルイ18世 (フランス王)が即位してフランスブルボン朝が復活した。
sen.e: In 1814, when Emperor Napoleon BONAPARTE abdicated from the throne after he had been defeated in the Napoleonic War, Louis XVIII (King of France), a younger brother of Louis XVI, ascended the throne to revive the Bourbon Dynasty of France.

In 1814, when Emperor Napoleon BONAPARTE abdicated from the throne after being defeated in the Napoleonic War, Louis XVIII (King of France), a younger brother of Louis XVI, ascended the throne to revive the Bourbon Dynasty of France.

In 1814, when the Emperor Napoleon BONAPARTE abdicated from the throne after being defeated in the Napoleonic War, Louis XVIII (King of France), a younger brother of Louis XVI, ascended the throne to revive the Bourbon Dynasty of France.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 翌年、ナポレオンのエルバ島脱出によってルイ18世は再び国外へ亡命するが、ナポレオンの支配が百日天下に終わると帰国した。
sen.e: In the following year, when Napoleon escaped from the Elba, Louis XVIII defected abroad again but returned soon to France after Napoleon's hundred days' rule ended.
In the following year, when Napoleon escaped from the Elba, Louis XVIII defected abroad again but returned to France soon after Napoleon's hundred days' rule ended.
In the following year, when Napoleon escaped from the Elba, Louis XVIII defected abroad again but returned to France soon after Napoleon's hundred days' rule ended.

sen.j: ブルボン朝は1830年に断絶し、オルレアン朝が成立したが、1848年革命によって王政は終焉した。
sen.e: The Bourbon Dynasty extinguished in 1830 to be followed by the Orleans Dynasty which ruled France until the monarchy was forced to discontinue by the revolution in 1848.
The Bourbon Dynasty was extinguished in 1830 to be followed by the Orleans Dynasty which ruled France until the monarchy was forced to discontinue by the revolution in 1848.
The Bourbon Dynasty was extinguished in 1830 to be followed by the Orleans Dynasty which ruled France until the monarchy was forced to discontinue by the revolution in 1848.

sen.j: 以後、フランス第二帝政の時期を経て、フランスに共和政が定着した。
sen.e: Subsequently, the republican constitution became settled in France through the period of the Second Imperial France.
Subsequently, the republican constitution became settled in France through the period of the Second Imperial France.
Subsequently, the republican constitution became settled in France through the period of the Second Imperial France.

sen.j: 1931年総選挙で共和主義派が勝利したのを受けてブルボン家のアルフォンソ13世 (スペイン王)が退位。
sen.e: In 1931, when a party of republicans won the general election, Alfonso XIII (King of Spain) stepped down from the throne.
In 1931, when a party of republicans won the general election, Alfonso XIII (King of Spain) stepped down from the throne.
In 1931, when a party of republicans won the general election, Alfonso XIII (King of Spain) stepped down from the throne.

sen.j: 共和政が発足した。
sen.e: Then, a republican government inaugurated.
Then, a republican government inaugurated.
Then, a republican government inaugurated.

sen.j: その後スペイン内戦によってフランシスコ・フランコ・バハモンデの独裁体制が1936年に発足した。
sen.e: Later in 1936, the Spanish Civil War brought about the dictatorship of Francisco Franco y Bahamonde.
sen.cmt: 用語登録では「フランシスコ・フランコ・バハモンデ」を"Francisco Paulino HERMENEGILDO"と訳しています。
sen.e: Later in 1936, the Spanish Civil War brought about the dictatorship of Francisco Franco y Bahamonde.
Later in 1936, the Spanish Civil War brought about the dictatorship of Francisco Franco y Bahamonde.

sen.j: フランコ自身は王政復古を望んでいたが、フアン (バルセロナ伯)元皇太子がフランコ体制を支持せず、フランコ自身が首相と摂政を兼ねる総統に就任して全権を掌握する体制が続いた。
sen.e: Although Franco himself desired restoration of royal rule, former Crown Prince Juan (Count of Barcelona) did not support Franco government, so that Franco assumed the post of supreme ruler which covered both posts of prime minister and regent and maintained the political system in order for him to keep full power of control over the nation..

Although Franco himself desired to restore royal rule, former Crown Prince Juan (Count of Barcelona) did not support the Franco government, so that Franco assumed the post of supreme ruler which covered both the posts of prime minister and regent and maintained the political system in order for him to keep full power of control over the nation..

Although Franco himself desired to restore royal rule, former Crown Prince Juan (Count of Barcelona) did not support the Franco government, so that Franco assumed the post of supreme ruler which covered both the posts of prime minister and regent and maintained the political system in order for him to keep full power of control over the nation..

sen.j: その後、1967年にドン・ファンの息子に当たるフアン・カルロス1世 (スペイン王)が皇太子に指名され、1975年にフランコが死去するとブルボン家による王制が復活した。
sen.e: Subsequently in 1967, Juan Carlos I (King of Spain), a child of Don Juan, was nominated as a Crown Prince who revived monarchy of Bourbon family after Franco died in 1975.
Subsequently in 1967, Juan Carlos I (King of Spain), a child of Don Juan, was nominated as a Crown Prince who the revived monarchy of Bourbon family after Franco died in 1975.
Subsequently in 1967, Juan Carlos I (King of Spain), a child of Don Juan, was nominated as a Crown Prince who the revived monarchy of Bourbon family after Franco died in 1975.

sen.j: なお1874年にも王政復古が行われている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, restoration of royal rule was realized in 1874, too.
Meanwhile, restoration of royal rule was realized in 1874, too.
Meanwhile, restoration of royal rule was realized in 1874, too.

sen.j: 1923年総選挙で共和派が勝利して、翌年12月の国民投票で共和制に移行。
sen.e: In 1923, a republican party won the general election, and in December of the following year the country changed itself into a republic by a national referendum.
In 1923, a republican party won the general election, and in December of the following year the country changed itself into a republic by a national referendum.
In 1923, a republican party won the general election, and in December of the following year the country changed itself into a republic by a national referendum.

sen.j: 国王ゲオルギオス2世 (ギリシャ王)は亡命する。
sen.e: King Georgios II (King of Greek) exiled himself.
King Georgios II (King of Greek) exiled himself.
King Georgios II (King of Greek) exiled himself.

sen.j: しかし汚職の横行と世界大恐慌の影響で政治的に行き詰まり、1935年11月3日の国民投票で王政復古が決定した。
sen.e: But, since internally rampant corruption and the worldwide Great Depression bogged the country down politically, it decided to revive monarchy by a national referendum on November 3, 1935.
But, since internally rampant corruption and the worldwide Great Depression bogged the country down politically, it decided to revive the monarchy by a national referendum on November 3, 1935.
But, since internally rampant corruption and the worldwide Great Depression bogged the country down politically, it decided to revive the monarchy by a national referendum on November 3, 1935.

sen.j: その後、1967年にパパドプロス大佐のクーデターによって国王コンスタンティノス2世 (ギリシャ王)が追放された。
sen.e: Subsequently, King Konstantinos II (King of Greek) was exiled by coups of Colonel Papadopoulos in 1967.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Subsequently, King Konstantinos II (King of Greek) was exiled by a coups by Colonel Papadopoulos in 1967.
Subsequently, King Konstantinos II (King of Greek) was exiled by a coups by Colonel Papadopoulos in 1967.

sen.j: 1973年に共和制を宣言。
sen.e: And, the country declared to become a republic in 1973.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And, the country declared itself a republic in 1973.
And, the country declared itself a republic in 1973.

sen.j: 1974年12月の国民投票でも承認された。
sen.e: This republican system of government was approved by a national referendum held in December, 1974.
This republican system of government was approved by a national referendum held in December, 1974.
This republican system of government was approved by a national referendum held in December, 1974.

sen.j: 1970年3月17日、当時の国王ノロドム・シハヌークが外遊中に、ロン・ノルによるクーデターによって王制が打倒され、クメール共和国が樹立。
sen.e: On March 17, 1970, coups by Lon NOL defeated the monarchy of King Norodom SIHANOUK while he was travelling abroad, and the Khmer Republic was established.
On March 17, 1970, coups by Lon NOL defeated the monarchy of King Norodom SIHANOUK while he was travelling abroad, and the Khmer Republic was established.
On March 17, 1970, coups by Lon NOL defeated the monarchy of King Norodom SIHANOUK while he was travelling abroad, and the Khmer Republic was established.

sen.j: 以後、民主カンプチア、ヘン・サムリン政権、カンボジア内戦等の激動の歴史を経て、国民議会総選挙により1993年に立憲君主制を採択。
sen.e: Since then, the country passed through tumultuous history, including Democratic Kampuchea, Heng Samrin Government, and civil wars in Cambodia, until 1993 when the country adopted constitutional monarchy by a general election for National Assembly.

Since then, the country passed through tumultuous times, including Democratic Kampuchea, Heng Samrin Government, and civil wars in Cambodia, until 1993 when the country adopted a constitutional monarchy by a general election for National Assembly.

Since then, the country passed through tumultuous times, including Democratic Kampuchea, Heng Samrin Government, and civil wars in Cambodia, until 1993 when the country adopted a constitutional monarchy by a general election for National Assembly.

sen.j: シハヌークが国王に復位し、王政復古が実現した。
sen.e: When SIHANOUK returned to the throne, restoration of royal rule in Cambodia became a reality.
When SIHANOUK returned to the throne, the restoration of royal rule in Cambodia finally became a reality.
When SIHANOUK returned to the throne, the restoration of royal rule in Cambodia finally became a reality.
